vocabulary.definition: something that is difficult or impossible to understand or explain
a game, toy, or problem designed to test ingenuity or knowledge
a picture or diagram made with a pencil, pen, or crayon rather than paint
a fact or piece of information that helps to solve a mystery or problem
at or to the far side of

article_caption: Three friends find a map in a library book and find a special key.

article_paragraphs.text: Leo is a student. He is in the big library. His friends are Mia and Sam. They are good friends. They have an old book. The book is red. It is a big, red book. The book is a mystery. Leo opens the book. A paper is in the book. The paper is yellow. It is a map. "What is this?" Mia asks. Sam looks. "It is a map!" The map is a puzzle. A drawing is on the map. It is a drawing of a chair.

A big, green chair. The friends look. Where is the green chair? The chair is in the library. They go to the green chair. They look under the chair. A new paper is there. This is clue two. The new paper has a drawing. The drawing is a big clock. They go to the big clock. A small box is behind the clock. It is a brown box. Other students are near the clock. Ben and Anna see the box. They want the box. They run. Leo, Mia, and Sam run.

They are all very fast. Mia is very fast. She gets the box. "I have it!" she says. Leo and Sam are happy. Ben and Anna are not happy. Mia has the box. The box is safe. Leo opens the box. What is inside? They look. A key is in the box. It is a very old key. The key is gold. It is a special key. It is the key to a secret garden. They are happy explorers.

vocab_fill.sentence: A is on the map.

writing_prompt: Who is your favorite character in the story? Is it Leo, Mia, or Sam? Write three sentences about why you like this character. (About 25 words)
